Re: License #: CB500316267
Dear Ms. Vasilovski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
3/26/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as
required by section 5111 of the public health
code, 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111.
Two of eight foster care files did not have current immunizations.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or parents
and the foster parents in the development of service
plans to enable the parent or parents and foster parents
to understand the plan for the child and the parents' and
the foster parent's role in assisting the agency in carrying
out the plan. An agency shall give a copy to and review
the parent-agency treatment plan with the parent or
parents and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the information
in the parent-agency treatment plan and any other
information about the child and the child's family is
confidential.
Two of eight foster care files each held one treatment plan that did not have a
signature from the caregiver or parent to indicate the plan was reviewed and
provided to them.
2

CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90-days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
One of three adoptive family assessments was not completed within the 90-day
timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
4/12/23 RENEWAL, CAP approved 5/1/23
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not requested or provided.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The CAP, approved 5/1/23, was the result of the 4/12/23 renewal evaluation. The
agency was cited regarding borrowed homes, timely adoption evaluations, Family
Team Meetings, and quarterly Medical Passports. The agency reported successful
implementation of their CAP over the past year. During the 2024 review
improvement was found in all areas. However, there was one repeat violation
regarding a timely adoption evaluation. The agency reported this to be due to
unusual circumstances related to the applicant, which resulted in a denial, outside
of the 90-day timeframe. The agency has already identified steps for a new CAP
to avoid this in the future.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment, dated 9/22/23, was reviewed and discussed
on-site. The CA reported ongoing efforts to continue improvement in the areas
cited in the 2023 review. Efforts included new tracking mechanisms, training,
Outlook calendar sharing, increased supervisor oversight, usage of electronic
3

signatures, and ongoing discussion regarding barriers to compliance. The CA
reported an overall increase in their key performance indicators.
The CA identified six unplanned moves for children over the past year. These
moves were from unlicensed relative homes, due to health issues of caregivers
and other unforeseen circumstances.
Financial Overview
The agency's 2022 financial audit was reviewed, as the 2023 review is not yet
complete. The agency's 2023 budget was also reviewed. No financial concerns
were found.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site: one supervisor and one caseworker. Both staff
reported they enjoy working at the agency and feel very supported by supervisors
and administration. Staff stated they believe FCS is a great place to work, their
caseloads are manageable, staff get along well and rely on one another, and
receive the support they need. Neither staff had any concerns or suggestions for
improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same office building as previous years.
There is adequate space for staff and clients to meet and hold parenting time. The
office has sufficient secure storage for confidential information.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
